definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: He 's an army sergeant. He needs a loud voice.
sentences.chinese: 大嗓门，因为他是个军士。

sentences.english: The drill sergeant begins by putting the fear of God up every new recruit .
sentences.chinese: 这个教练军士一开始就给全体新兵一个下马威。

sentences.english: An Enlisted Soldier's rank can range from Private to Sergeant Major of the Army.
sentences.chinese: 一名募征兵的军衔从列兵至总军士长。
军士麦考夫是我的传令兵。
他在战斗中指挥过军士。

sentences.english: You can fade away and the sergeant and I will take over.
sentences.chinese: 你可以离开了，军士和我会接管的。

sentences.english: Sergeants Swordsmen are professional warriors, drawn from the lower classes.
sentences.chinese: 长剑军士属于职业部队，其成员多来自社会下层平民。

sentences.english: Mounted Sergeants are the lesser armed cavalry that ride in support of the knights.
sentences.chinese: 骑马军士装备较差，是支持骑士作战的附属部队。

sentences.english: The sergeant major barked out the order.
Brad had said he was no longer in the service, but that he had been an air force tech sergeant.
sentences.chinese: 布拉德说他已经退伍，原先是个空军技术军士。

sentences.english: The general told his sergeants to advance.

sentences.chinese: 军士长全身被汗浸湿透了。

sentences.english: The sergeant was content with such a compromise.
sentences.chinese: 军士为双方的妥协感到满意。

sentences.english: You ready to use that weapon, tech sergeant?
sentences.chinese: 你会用那杆枪了吧，技术军士？

sentences.english: You are the most experienced non-commissioned officer we have left.
sentences.chinese: 你是我们剩下的最有经验的军士。

definition: defense of the imperial palace or of the capital/the palace guard (or a member of that unit)
